text: The patient's overall condition has significantly improved since admission for pneumonia. Afebrile for 48 hours, tolerating oral antibiotics well. Plan for discharge tomorrow.
Patient developed acute renal failure (Creatinine increase from 1.1 to 3.5) following the administration of IV gentamicin. Discontinued medication and initiated fluid resuscitation.
A mild headache was reported by the patient after the lumbar puncture. It resolved completely with caffeine and Tylenol. No signs of post-LP cerebral spinal fluid leak.

A medication error was identified during chart review. Patient received 10mg of morphine instead of the prescribed 5mg. Patient is currently lethargic with respiratory rate of 8. Naloxone administered.
Post-op check on the skin graft shows it is healing properly with good vascularization. The patient is comfortable and reports minimal pain at the donor site.
Patient experienced severe, debilitating joint pain and swelling in both knees, an unlisted side effect of the new biologic agent. Treatment paused immediately.
Unexpected drop in platelet count to 25,000/uL observed after starting heparin infusion. Suspected Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT). All heparin products stopped.
Follow-up appointment for chemotherapy shows continued progress. Tumor markers are decreasing and the patient is tolerating treatment with manageable side effects.
